name: Martin Yan
description: Chef Martin Yan is a Chinese-American chef who is known for his popular TV show Yan Can Cook and his expertise in Chinese cuisine. He has written many cookbooks and has won numerous awards for his culinary skills.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken Recipe
ingredients: 1/2 cup dried wood ear mushrooms, soaked in hot water for 15 minutes and thinly sliced
recipes.cooking_method: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, chili paste, sugar, cornstarch, and sesame oil.Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add chicken and stir-fry until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.Add garlic and ginger and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add bell peppers, celery, and green onions and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes.Add the sauce to the wok and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken and vegetables.Stir in roasted peanuts and serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Hot and Sour Soup Recipe
recipes.cooking_method: In a large pot, bring chicken stock to a boil. Add wood ear mushrooms, bamboo shoots, and tofu and simmer for 5-7 minutes.Add rice vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, chili paste, white pepper, and sugar and stir to combine.In a small bowl, whisk together cornstarch and water. Slowly pour the mixture into the soup, stirring constantly, until the soup thickens.Pour the lightly beaten eggs into the soup, stirring constantly, until the eggs are cooked and resemble ribbons.Garnish with sliced green onions and serve hot.

recipes.name: Three Cup Chicken Recipe
ingredients: boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into small pieces
recipes.cooking_method: Heat vegetable oil and sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add garlic and ginger and stir-fry for 1 minute.Add chicken and stir-fry until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice wine, sesame oil, and sugar.

name: Yu Bo
description: Chef Yu Bo is a highly acclaimed Chinese female chef who is known for her expertise in Sichuan cuisine. She has won numerous awards for her culinary skills and has been featured in many top publications.

recipes.name: Mapo Tofu
ingredients: firm tofu, cut into small cubes
recipes.cooking_method: In a wok or large skillet, heat the oil over high heat.Add the garlic, ginger, and ground pork, and stir-fry until the pork is no longer pink.Add the doubanjiang and Sichuan peppercorns, and stir-fry for 30 seconds.Add the tofu and chicken broth, and gently stir to combine.Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes.Stir in the cornstarch mixture and continue cooking until the sauce has thickened.Garnish with sliced green onions and serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Soy Sauce Braised Pork Belly
ingredients: pork belly, cut into 1 inch cubes
recipes.cooking_method: In a wok or large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat.Add the pork belly and stir-fry until browned on all sides.Add the soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and brown sugar, and stir to combine.Add the ginger and garlic, and stir-fry for 30 seconds.Add the water, star anise, cinnamon stick, and dried red chili peppers, and bring to a boil.Reduce heat to a simmer, cover, and cook for 1-1.5 hours, or until the pork is tender.Serve hot with steamed rice and vegetables.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Shrimp with Snow Peas
recipes.cooking_method: In a wok or large skillet, heat the oil over high heat.Add the garlic and ginger, and stir-fry for 30 seconds.Add the shrimp and stir-fry until pink and cooked through.Add the snow peas and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, until tender-crisp.In a small bowl, whisk together the Shaoxing wine, soy sauce, cornstarch, and water.Add the sauce to the wok and stir until the sauce thickens.Stir in the sesame oil and serve hot with rice.

name: Xiaoxi Li
description: Chef Xiaoxi Li is a Chinese chef who is known for her innovative approach to traditional Chinese cuisine. She has been recognized for her skills in creating unique and flavorful dishes that blend traditional Chinese ingredients with modern techniques.

recipes.name: Scallion Oil Noodles
ingredients: fresh or dried Chinese egg noodles
recipes.cooking_method: Cook the noodles according to package instructions, then rinse under cold water and drain well.In a small pan, heat the oil over medium heat until hot but not smoking.Add the scallions and cook until the scallions turn slightly brown and crispy.Remove from heat and let cool for a few minutes.In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, salt, and Sichuan peppercorns (if using).Pour the scallion oil over the noodles and toss well to coat.Drizzle the sauce over the noodles and toss again.Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and serve at room temperature.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.cooking_method: To make Spaghetti Carbonara, start by cooking spaghetti in boiling salted water until al dente. While the spaghetti is cooking, cook diced pancetta in a frying pan over medium heat until crispy. In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated parmesan cheese, and black pepper. Drain the cooked spaghetti and add it to the frying pan with the pancetta. Remove the pan from the heat and pour the egg mixture over the spaghetti, tossing quickly to coat the spaghetti and cook the eggs. Serve immediately with additional grated parmesan cheese and black pepper on top.

recipes.name: Spicy Tofu Stir-Fry
recipes.cooking_method: In a wok or large skillet, heat the oil over high heat.Add the garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds.Add the tofu and stir-fry until lightly browned on all sides.Add the bell peppers and onion, and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until tender.In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, Sichuan peppercorn oil, sugar, salt, and ground Sichuan peppercorns.Pour the sauce over the tofu and vegetables, and stir-fry until everything is evenly coated.Transfer to a serving dish, garnish with chopped scallions, and serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Lan Guijun
description: Chef Lan Guijun is a well-known Chinese chef who specializes in Cantonese cuisine. She has received many accolades for her culinary skills and has been recognized for her ability to create dishes that are both delicious and visually stunning.

recipes.name: Mapo Tofu
ingredients: firm tofu, cut into small cubes
recipes.cooking_method: In a wok or large skillet, heat the oil over high heat.Add the garlic, ginger, and ground pork, and stir-fry until the pork is no longer pink.Add the doubanjiang and Sichuan peppercorns, and stir-fry for 30 seconds.Add the tofu and chicken broth, and gently stir to combine.Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes.Stir in the cornstarch mixture and continue cooking until the sauce has thickened.Garnish with sliced green onions and serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Osso Buco
recipes.cooking_method: To make Osso Buco, start by browning veal shanks in a large Dutch oven or braising pan. Remove the veal shanks from the pan and set aside. In the same pan, saut√© diced onion, carrots, celery, and garlic until softened. Add tomato paste and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add beef broth and white wine and bring to a simmer. Return the veal shanks to the pan, cover, and simmer for 2-3 hours or until the meat is tender and falls off the bone. Serve with gremolata (a mixture of minced garlic, lemon zest, and chopped parsley) on top.

recipes.name: Boiled Fish in Hot Chili Oil
ingredients: white fish fillet, cut into bite-sized pieces
recipes.cooking_method: Heat the oil in a wok or large pot over high heat.Add the Sichuan peppercorns and dried red chili peppers, and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.Add the garlic, ginger, and scallions, and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes, until lightly browned.Add the fish, soy sauce, black vinegar, sugar, and salt, and stir gently to combine.Add enough water to cover the fish, and bring to a boil.Reduce heat to a simmer, and let cook for 5-10 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and tender.Transfer to a serving dish, garnish with cilantro, and serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Ming Tsai
description: Chef Ming Tsai is a Chinese-American chef who is known for his innovative approach to Chinese cuisine. He has won numerous awards for his culinary skills and has hosted many TV shows, including Simply Ming, where he combines Chinese and other international cuisines to create unique dishes.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken Recipe
ingredients: 1/2 cup dried wood ear mushrooms, soaked in hot water for 15 minutes and thinly sliced
recipes.cooking_method: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, chili paste, sugar, cornstarch, and sesame oil.Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add chicken and stir-fry until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.Add garlic and ginger and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add bell peppers, celery, and green onions and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes.Add the sauce to the wok and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken and vegetables.Stir in roasted peanuts and serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.cooking_method: To make Spaghetti Carbonara, cook spaghetti in boiling salted water until al dente. While the spaghetti is cooking, cook diced pancetta in a pan until crispy. Add minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes. In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, grated parmesan cheese, and black pepper. Drain the cooked spaghetti and add it to the pan with the pancetta and garlic. Remove the pan from the heat and add the egg mixture, tossing the spaghetti quickly to coat. The heat from the spaghetti will cook the eggs and create a creamy sauce. Serve hot with additional grated parmesan cheese and black pepper on top.

recipes.name: Tiramisu
recipes.cooking_method: To make Tiramisu, start by brewing strong espresso and adding Marsala wine. In a separate bowl, whisk together mascarpone cheese and heavy cream until light and fluffy. Dip ladyfingers in the espresso mixture and arrange them in a single layer in a dish. Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers. Repeat with another layer of ladyfingers and the remaining mascarpone mixture. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2-3 hours or overnight. Before serving, dust the top with cocoa powder.

name: Ken Hom
description: Chef Ken Hom is a Chinese-British chef who has authored many cookbooks and hosted many TV shows on Chinese cuisine. He is known for his expertise in Cantonese cuisine and his ability to teach the art of Chinese cooking to home cooks.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Beef with Ginger and Scallions
ingredients: flank steak, sliced thinly across the grain
scallions, sliced thinly on the diagonal
recipes.cooking_method: In a wok or large skillet, heat the oil over high heat.Add the ginger and stir-fry for 30 seconds.Add the beef and stir-fry until browned on all sides.Add the scallions and stir-fry for another 30 seconds.In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, sugar, and salt.Pour the sauce over the beef and stir-fry until everything is evenly coated.Transfer to a serving dish and serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Steamed Fish with Ginger and Scallions
ingredients: whole fish, about 2 lbs, cleaned and scaled
recipes.cooking_method: Place the fish on a heatproof plate that will fit inside a steamer basket.In a small bowl, whisk together the ginger, scallions, soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, sugar, and salt.Pour the sauce over the fish, making sure to coat both sides.Place the plate in a steamer basket, and steam over high heat for 10-12 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through.Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Panna Cotta
recipes.cooking_method: To make Panna Cotta, heat heavy cream and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract and gelatin until completely dissolved. Pour the mixture into ramekins or dessert glasses and chill in the refrigerator for at least 2-3 hours or until set. Serve with fresh berries on top.
